snippet: The ruling Workers’ Party declared Kim Jong-un to be “supreme leader” and awarded him the title of first secretary during the country’s first major political gathering in a year and a half.
abstract: North Korea's ruling Workers’ Party declares Kim Jong-un to be 'supreme leader' and awards him the title of first secretary during the country’s first major political gathering in a year and a half; he is elevated to chairman of the party’s central military commission and granted membership in the Politburo and its presidium; the inevitable elevation caps his rise to the pinnacle of party, military and state leadership.
lead_paragraph: The ruling Workers’ Party declared Kim Jong-un to be “supreme leader” and awarded him the title of first secretary during the country’s first major political gathering in a year and a half.

headline.seo: North Korean Leadership Solidified as Launching Nears
headline.main: As Rocket Launching Nears, North Korea Continues Shift to New ‘Supreme Leader’
headline.print_headline: As Rocket Launching Nears, North Korea Continues Shift to New ‘Supreme Leader’
